name: Earth
column9: with liquid water on the surface and a breathable atmosphere. It is the only known planet to harbor life.

name: Mercury
description: Closest planet to the Sun with a heavily cratered surface and no atmosphere.

name: Neptune
description: Has a deep blue color and 14 moons
column9: with a turbulent atmosphere of hydrogen

name: Jupiter
description: Largest planet in the solar system with 79 known moons

name: Saturn
description: Known for its rings made of ice particles
column9: with 82 known moons and a thick atmosphere of hydrogen

name: Mars
column9:
it has a thin atmosphere and no liquid water on the surface, but may have subsurface liquid water and potential for microbial life.
Venus,Sun,Terrestrial,0.815,0.723,0.949,False,Has a thick, toxic atmosphere with extreme greenhouse effect, making it the hottest planet in the solar system.
Uranus,Sun,Ice giant,14.536,19.18,4.007,False,Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun and is the third-largest planet in the Solar System. It has the coldest planetary atmosphere in the Solar System, with a minimum temperature of -224 °C. Uranus is known for its unique feature: it rotates on its side, with an axial tilt of 98 degrees.
Kepler-62f,Alpha Centauri A,Terrestrial,0.63,0.04,1.41,True,Exoplanet in the habitable zone of a K-type star, potentially with liquid water on its surface.
Antares b,Antares,Gas Giant,13.67,550,1.32,False,A gas giant planet that orbits a red supergiant star. Antares b is one of the few exoplanets that has been discovered using the radial velocity method, and its extreme proximity to its host star means that it has a surface temperature of over 1,500 degrees Celsius.
WASP-47e,Rigel,Neptune-like,9.3,0.05,3.34,False,Exoplanet with a mass similar to Neptune, orbiting a star with a binary companion.
Kepler-1625b,Vega,Jupiter-like,1.47,0.05,1.5,False,Exoplanet in a binary star system, with a large size similar to Jupiter.
HD 131399Ab,Triangulum X-1,Jupiter-like,4,82,1.5,False,Exoplanet orbiting a star in a triple star system, with an extremely wide orbit.
